00044 typedef struct {
00045     xed_uint64_t   displacement; 
00046     xed_uint32_t   displacement_width;
00047 } xed_enc_displacement_t; /* fixme bad name */
00048 
00050 
00051 
00052 
00053 XED_INLINE static  xed_enc_displacement_t xdisp(xed_uint64_t   displacement,
00054                                                 xed_uint32_t   displacement_width   ) {
00055     xed_enc_displacement_t x;
00056     x.displacement = displacement;
00057     x.displacement_width = displacement_width;
00058     return x;
00059 }

00062 typedef struct {
00063     xed_reg_enum_t seg;
00064     xed_reg_enum_t base;
00065     xed_reg_enum_t index;
00066     xed_uint32_t   scale;
00067     xed_enc_displacement_t disp;
00068 } xed_memop_t;
00069 
00070 
00071 typedef enum {
00072     XED_ENCODER_OPERAND_TYPE_INVALID,
00073     XED_ENCODER_OPERAND_TYPE_BRDISP,
00074     XED_ENCODER_OPERAND_TYPE_REG,
00075     XED_ENCODER_OPERAND_TYPE_IMM0,
00076     XED_ENCODER_OPERAND_TYPE_SIMM0,
00077     XED_ENCODER_OPERAND_TYPE_IMM1,
00078     XED_ENCODER_OPERAND_TYPE_MEM,
00079     XED_ENCODER_OPERAND_TYPE_PTR,
00080     XED_ENCODER_OPERAND_TYPE_SEG0, /* special for things with suppressed implicit memops */
00081     XED_ENCODER_OPERAND_TYPE_SEG1  /* special for things with suppressed implicit memops */
00082 } xed_encoder_operand_type_t;
00083 
00084 typedef struct {
00085     xed_encoder_operand_type_t  type;
00086     union {
00087         xed_reg_enum_t reg;
00088         xed_int32_t brdisp;
00089         xed_uint64_t imm0;
00090         xed_uint8_t imm1;
00091         xed_memop_t mem;
00092     } u;
00093     xed_uint32_t width;
00094 } xed_encoder_operand_t;

00100 XED_INLINE static  xed_encoder_operand_t xrelbr(xed_int32_t brdisp, xed_uint_t width) {
00101     xed_encoder_operand_t o;
00102     o.type = XED_ENCODER_OPERAND_TYPE_BRDISP;
00103     o.u.brdisp = brdisp;
00104     o.width = width;
00105     return o;
00106 }

00188 XED_INLINE static  xed_encoder_operand_t xmem_b(xed_reg_enum_t base, xed_uint_t width) {
00189     xed_encoder_operand_t o;
00190     o.type = XED_ENCODER_OPERAND_TYPE_MEM;
00191     o.u.mem.base = base;
00192     o.u.mem.seg = XED_REG_INVALID;
00193     o.u.mem.index= XED_REG_INVALID;
00194     o.u.mem.scale = 0;
00195     o.u.mem.disp.displacement = 0;
00196     o.u.mem.disp.displacement_width = 0;
00197     o.width = width;
00198     return o;
00199 }

00287 typedef union {
00288     struct {
00289         xed_uint32_t rep               :1;
00290         xed_uint32_t repne             :1;
00291         xed_uint32_t lock              :1;
00292         xed_uint32_t br_hint_taken     :1;
00293         xed_uint32_t br_hint_not_taken :1;
00294     } s;
00295     xed_uint32_t i;
00296 }  xed_encoder_prefixes_t;
00297 
00298 #define XED_ENCODER_OPERANDS_MAX 3 /* FIXME */
00299 typedef struct {
00300     xed_state_t mode;
00301     xed_iclass_enum_t iclass; /*FIXME: use iform instead? or allow either */
00302     xed_uint32_t effective_operand_width;
00303 
00304     /* the effective_address_width is only requires to be set for
00305      *  instructions * with implicit suppressed memops or memops with no
00306      *  base or index regs.  When base or index regs are present, XED pick
00307      *  this up automatically from the register names.
00308 
00309      * FIXME: make effective_address_width required by all encodes for
00310      * unifority. Add to xed_inst[0123]() APIs??? */
00311     xed_uint32_t effective_address_width; 
00312 
00313     xed_encoder_prefixes_t prefixes;
00314     xed_uint32_t noperands;
00315     xed_encoder_operand_t operands[XED_ENCODER_OPERANDS_MAX];
00316 } xed_encoder_instruction_t;
00317

00324 
00325 XED_INLINE static void xaddr(xed_encoder_instruction_t* x, 
00326                              xed_uint_t width) {
00327     x->effective_address_width = width;
00328 }
00329 
00330 
00332 XED_INLINE static  void xrep(xed_encoder_instruction_t* x) { 
00333     x->prefixes.s.rep=1;
00334 }
00335 
00337 XED_INLINE static  void xrepne(xed_encoder_instruction_t* x) { 
00338     x->prefixes.s.repne=1;
00339 }
00340 
00342 XED_INLINE static  void xlock(xed_encoder_instruction_t* x) { 
00343     x->prefixes.s.lock=1;
00344 }

00357 /* FIXME: rather than return the xed_encoder_instruction_t I can make
00358  * another version that returns a xed_encoder_request_t. Saves silly

00364 
00367 XED_INLINE static  void xed_inst0(
00368     xed_encoder_instruction_t* inst,
00369     xed_state_t mode,
00370     xed_iclass_enum_t iclass,
00371     xed_uint_t effective_operand_width) {
00372 
00373     inst->mode=mode;
00374     inst->iclass = iclass;
00375     inst->effective_operand_width = effective_operand_width;
00376     inst->effective_address_width = 0;
00377     inst->prefixes.i = 0;
00378     inst->noperands = 0;
00379 }
00380 
00383 XED_INLINE static  void xed_inst1(
00384     xed_encoder_instruction_t* inst,
00385     xed_state_t mode,
00386     xed_iclass_enum_t iclass,
00387     xed_uint_t effective_operand_width,
00388     xed_encoder_operand_t op0) {
00389     
00390     inst->mode=mode;
00391     inst->iclass = iclass;
00392     inst->effective_operand_width = effective_operand_width;
00393     inst->effective_address_width = 0;
00394     inst->prefixes.i = 0;
00395     inst->operands[0] = op0;
00396     inst->noperands = 1;
00397 }
00398 
00401 XED_INLINE static  void xed_inst2(
00402     xed_encoder_instruction_t* inst,
00403     xed_state_t mode,
00404     xed_iclass_enum_t iclass,
00405     xed_uint_t effective_operand_width,
00406     xed_encoder_operand_t op0,
00407     xed_encoder_operand_t op1) {
00408 
00409     inst->mode=mode;
00410     inst->iclass = iclass;
00411     inst->effective_operand_width = effective_operand_width;
00412     inst->effective_address_width = 0;
00413     inst->prefixes.i = 0;
00414     inst->operands[0] = op0;
00415     inst->operands[1] = op1;
00416     inst->noperands = 2;
00417 }
00418 
00421 XED_INLINE static  void xed_inst3(
00422     xed_encoder_instruction_t* inst,
00423     xed_state_t mode,
00424     xed_iclass_enum_t iclass,
00425     xed_uint_t effective_operand_width,
00426     xed_encoder_operand_t op0,
00427     xed_encoder_operand_t op1,
00428     xed_encoder_operand_t op2) {
00429 
00430     inst->mode=mode;
00431     inst->iclass = iclass;
00432     inst->effective_operand_width = effective_operand_width;
00433     inst->effective_address_width = 0;
00434     inst->prefixes.i = 0;
00435     inst->operands[0] = op0;
00436     inst->operands[1] = op1;
00437     inst->operands[2] = op2;
00438     inst->noperands = 3;
00439 }
